Error location 1: "Menstrual hormones may be more irritable"
Explanation for error 1: The phrase "Menstrual hormones may be more irritable" changes the meaning of the original phrase "Menstrual hormones may make you more irritable." The original phrase focuses on the effect on the individual, while the incorrect translation implies that the hormones themselves are more irritable.
Error type 2: Wrong grammatical register (eg, inappropriately informal pronouns). Internal inconsistency (not related to terminology)
Major/minor: Major

Explanation for error 2: The phrase "which is very unlucky" is an informal and incorrect translation of "which is very unpleasant." The original phrase focuses on the negative aspect of the hormone changes, while the incorrect translation adds an unrelated idea of "unluckiness."
